Articles.Content:
Apparently launch clamps now allow parts to be placed on them. This makes my night launches a lot more spectacular:

As well as allows for launch gantries!

I wonder what else the devs snuck in that we haven't noticed yet?

Nice.

Of course, you just know something fun will come out of this from those people who like to purposely try and break the physics engine.

Apparently launch clamps now allow parts to be placed on them.

Awesome, I really felt this was missing, thanks for the update!

Another awesome fix that will be completely overlooked/ignored by the whiners proclaiming this update a failure because it only contains 7 parts.

Absolutely badass!

/heads off to start trying to "abuse" the new feature
Oh dear. Let the wackiness begin!
You mean I can run a ladder right up to the doors of my capsules???
Well, now... This IS cool. Thanks!
That makes a few of my seats work better.
Oh yes. This I like.
That's actually really nice. It gives a more immersive feeling when you launch during the night.

That looks amazing!

*Runs off to play with the newfound ability
WOW great find! Been wanting this. Now all we need in the tower back and some gantries, smoke/steam effects!

WOW great find! Been wanting this. Now all we need in the tower back and some gantries, smoke/steam effects!

Old gantry had none practical use, we just need more parts like launch clamps, so we could build "gantry" for our own .
We could build a space ladder!
I thought this was a feature for a while now. I guess I was wrong; I never tried in the older versions

My my... there used to be a mod for this, but happy it's finally integrated.

The other feature people have been mentioning is that when you click on Ap and Pe markers, they lock. Hasn't worked for me though.

Also, did anyone notice that they changed the names of the photovoltaic panels, from A and B to 1x6 and 2x3?

Oh, imagine all the frustration saved.

Also, did anyone notice that they changed the names of the photovoltaic panels, from A and B to 1x6 and 2x3?

Oh, imagine all the frustration saved.

They did? Success!

So.. Now You can put fuel tanks on the clamps, and add a fuel line to your first engines. Then you can do a real rocket launch style start-the-engine-up-then-go instead of starting at full power and releasing clamps at the same time.

Also, did anyone notice that they changed the names of the photovoltaic panels, from A and B to 1x6 and 2x3?

Oh, imagine all the frustration saved.

I noticed that... That saved me a lot of annoying testing from always forgetting which was which
YOU WILL NOT GO TO SPACE TODAY
I wanna try to lift a launch clap now even though it might not work XD
Someone could build an elevator by hooking some wheels around the clamp attatched to a platform with a seat powered to go up and down by RCS.

Someone could build an elevator by hooking some wheels around the clamp attatched to a platform with a seat powered to go up and down by RCS.

could the wheels not cause it to climb? the brakes would have to be capable of preventing freefall. hmmm.
Did nobody notice the new Whack A Kerbal debug feature?
